text: Start by warming up the pan (or whatever cooking surface you decide to use). You can lightly butter it if you would like the quesadilla to brown slightly, just don't overdo it. As the tortilla warms up put a layer of cheese on one half of it. You're going to fold the other half over. Add whatever other ingredients you like, or none at all. This is the part where you get to make the quesadilla just the way you like it. Put another light layer of cheese on top. The cheese holds it all together so you want it touching both sides of the quesadilla once you fold it over. Add the hot sauce now in order to let it melt with all the ingredients, but you can also add it after the cheese has melted by opening your "dilla" back up.  Fold the other half of the quesadilla over and let it sit until the bottom side looks slightly browned.  Flip and repeat the last step - let it brown slightly.  Once the cheese is melted and you think it's ready, dig in! It's quick, easy, and delicious. You can dip it in salsa, guacamole or sour cream if you would like. Finished.
